description.plain:
Anaïs Oluwatoyin Estelle Marinho (born 9 August 2000), better known by her stage name Arlo Parks, is a British singer-songwriter.

Born in Paris and raised in Hammersmith, West London, her father is Nigerian and her mother Chadian-French.

Parks debuted in November 2018 releasing the single “Cola,” followed in 2019 by two EPs, Super Sad Generation and Sophie.

Parks' debut album, Collapsed in Sunbeams, received wide acclaim, winning the Mercury Prize in 2021, and being nominated for “Best Alternative Album” for the 2022 Grammy Awards.
